ai.summary: A challenging 135.9 km long-distance hike across North Wales in the UK. The route combines coastal paths, upland moorland, and rural lanes, with significant elevation gain and remote sections. Suitable for experienced hikers comfortable with navigation and variable weather.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain including coastal cliff and beach segments, rocky uplands, heather moorland, forest tracks, and farm lanes. Expect exposed sections and occasional boggy ground; navigation and footing can be challenging in unsettled conditions.
ai.safety_notes: The route includes remote upland and coastal segments with limited mobile signal. Good navigation skills are essential; carry map, compass, and/or GPS device. Weather in North Wales changes quickly; pack layers, waterproofs, and warm clothing. Plan for long days with possible gaps between services; carry sufficient food and water. Inform someone of your itinerary and expected return. Be cautious on exposed ridges and wet or boggy ground; wear sturdy footwear and consider trekking poles. If conditions are severe, consider shorter splits or postponing.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (approximately May–September) offer the best conditions in North Wales. Autumn and winter are possible with experience and extra caution due to higher weather risk and shorter daylight.
